verb.description: Arrange for compensation in the event of damage to or loss of (property), or injury to or the death of (someone), in exchange for regular advance payments to a company or government agency.
examples: the table should be insured for $2,500
the company had insured itself against a fall of the dollar
businesses can insure against exchange rate fluctuations

verb.description: Secure or protect someone against (a possible contingency)
examples: by appeasing Celia they might insure themselves against further misfortune
such changes could insure against further violence and unrest

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense assure someone of something): alteration of ensure.
